events.title: More than 200 killed in coltan mine collapse in eastern DRC, officials say
events.description: Rubaya mine produces about 15% of the worldâ€™s coltan, which is processed into tantalum, used in mobile phones More than 200 people were killed this week in a collapse at the Rubaya coltan mine in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo, Lumumba Kambere Muyisa, a spokesperson for the rebel-appointed governor of the province where the mine is located, told Reuters on Friday. Rubaya produces about 15% of the worldâ€™s coltan, which is processed into tantalum â€“ a heat-resistant metal that is in high demand by makers of mobile phones, computers, aerospace components and gas turbines. The site, where local people dig manually for a few dollars a day, has been under the control of the M23 rebel group since 2024. Continue reading...

events.title: At a clown school near Paris, failure is the lesson
events.description: For decades, students at the Ecole Philippe Gaulier have been paying to bomb onstage. The goal isn't laughs â€” it's learning how to take the humiliation and keep going.

events.title: U.S. intervention in Venezuela divides Houston
events.description: In nearly two dozen interviews, Houstonians expressed everything from admiration and relief to skepticism and dread following the seizure of leader NicolÃ¡s Maduro.

events.title: After backsliding, democracy often comes back weaker and more fragile
events.description: Losing democracy once can make it harder to restore it, even after a democratic government returns to power. University of Birmingham professor Nic Cheeseman analyzed three decades of data.

events.title: With decades-long restrictions lifted, a Pakistani brewery has started exporting beer
events.description: Drinking is illegal for Pakistan's Muslim majority, but Murree Brewery's beer has long been available to non-Muslims and foreigners there. Now it's being exported to the U.K., Japan and Portugal. Is the U.S. next?

events.title: Germany news: Energy cooperation with Saudi Arabia to expand
events.description: During a visit to Riyadh, Germany's Economy Minister Katherina Reiche said companies from the two countries will work together to strengthen the ties between them.

events.title: Epstein files: UK PM Starmer says ex-prince Andrew should testify in US
events.description: A new batch of Epstein files has ratcheted up the heat on Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor over his links with the pedophile financier. Now, the British PM says the former prince should testify in the US Congress.

events.title: New US envoy arrives in Venezuela after Maduro's ouster
events.description: The arrival of charge d'affaires Laura Dogu comes one month after US forces kidnapped leader Nicolas Maduro and brought him to New York to face trial. Dogu is a veteran diplomat and Spanish speaker.

events.title: Liam Ramos: Judge orders release of 5-year-old ICE detainee
events.description: The boy and his father had been detained by US immigration agents during a Minneapolis raid earlier this month. An image of the boy during the raid sparked outrage and brought a defense from US Vice President JD Vance.

events.title: Belarus: Snow and cold used to torture political prisoners
events.description: Former political prisoners tell DW that winter in Belarus prisons is brutal during cold, snowy winters like this one â€” because snow and freezing temperatures are used by guards to torment them.

events.title: An undying trend: How vampires like those in 'Sinners' hold a mirror to society
events.description: As the horror movie "Sinners" stands poised to sweep the Oscars, we take a look at how and why the vampire genre has long captivated audiences â€” from folklore to film. Is this trend truly immortal?

events.title: Italy church restoration probed after Meloni angel lookalike
events.description: Many have noted a striking resemblance between the face of an angel in a restored church in Rome and that of Italy's prime minister. "No, decidedly I do not resemble an angel," Giorgia Meloni has said.

events.title: Massive outage knocks out power across Ukraine, Moldova
events.description: Disruptions to Ukraine's power grid have led to outages there and in neighboring Moldova. Kyiv's metro and water supply have both been affected.

events.title: Alcaraz defeats Djokovic to win Australian Open, completing career grand slam
events.description: Spain's Carlos Alcaraz dismissed a slow start to blast past Serbia's Novak Djokovic in Melbourne on Sunday, becoming the youngest man to win all four majors. It's Djokovic's first defeat in a Melbourne final, having won the last 10, meaning he will have to continue the search for his landmark 25th major.

events.title: Elena Rybakina stuns Aryna Sabalenka to claim first Australian Open title
events.description: Elena Rybakina won her first Grand Slam in nearly four years by beating the top seed in Melbourne (6-4, 4-6, 6-4). Sabalenka, who was leading 3-0 in the final set, has now lost three of her last four major finals.

events.title: Israel reopens Gaza's Rafah crossing to limited foot traffic
events.description: Israel on Sunday partially open the Rafah crossing â€“ a vital gateway linking Gaza and Egypt which has remained largely closed for more than 18 months. The crossing was initially opened to foot traffic, but Israel has not yet said how many people will be allowed to cross and whether those seeking to return to Gaza will be permitted entry.

events.title: Record-breaking Alcaraz beats Djokovic to win Australian Open
events.description: Carlos Alcaraz has become the youngest ever man to complete a career Grand Slam after defeating Novak Djokovic in the Australian Open final.

events.title: Rafah border to reopen to allow limited crossings between Gaza and Egypt
events.description: The Rafah border between Gaza and Egypt is to reopen after nearly two years of near-total closure.

events.title: Boxer loses hairpiece in the ring
events.description: American boxer Jarrell Miller won his heavyweight bout in New York by a hair's breadth on Saturday - but lost his wig when the toupee started to came away.

events.title: Macaulay Culkin pays tribute to Home Alone star Catherine O'Hara
events.description: Catherine O'Hara, the Emmy-winning actress who starred as Kevin's mother in Home Alone and the eccentric Moira Rose in Schitt's Creek, has died.

events.title: Further Russia-Ukraine talks scheduled for next week, says Zelenskyy
events.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has announced the next round of peace talks between Russian and Ukrainian delegations will take place on Wednesday and Thursday in Abu Dhabi

events.title: India's budget boosts infrastructure spending while vowing fiscal discipline
events.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modiâ€™s government has presented an annual budget focused on sustaining economic growth despite volatile markets

events.title: NATO's ability to deter Russia has taken a hit with trans-Atlantic infighting
events.description: NATO's ability to deter Russia has taken a huge hit as trust within the alliance erodes

events.title: Costa Ricans vote on outgoing president's conservative populist program
events.description: Costa Rican voters are set to decide between continuing the policies of outgoing conservative populist Rodrigo Chaves by electing his selected successor â€” or giving a new chance to traditional parties seeking to shed a reputation as being self-serving

events.title: Children with disabilities find joy and support through horse therapy in Taiwan
events.description: At the Therapeutic Riding Center of Taiwan, children with conditions like cerebral palsy, autism, and ADHD find therapy and companionship through horse riding

events.title: US ambassador arrives in Venezuela to reopen diplomatic mission after 7 years
events.description: U.S. Ambassador Laura Dogu has arrived in Caracas.

events.title: Pope gets invitation to visit Peru during a Vatican garden party, then stays for lunch
events.description: Peruâ€™s ambassador to the Holy See has publicly invited Pope Leo XIV to visit

events.title: Japan, Britain to boost cybersecurity and critical minerals cooperation as Chinaâ€™s influence grows
events.description: Japan and Britain have agreed to boost cooperation on cybersecurity and the supply of critical minerals

events.title: Canada's Conservatives keep Poilievre as leader despite election loss
events.description: Members of Canadaâ€™s Conservative opposition party voted to keep Perre Poilievre as the partyâ€™s leader despite his election loss last year and recent defections

events.title: Texas A&M moves to end womenâ€™s and gender studies degree program
events.description: Texas A&M eliminated its women's and gender studies degree program, citing "limited student interest" and policy compliance after a comprehensive course review.

events.title: â€˜Serial Killer Whispererâ€™ reveals how he cracked Americaâ€™s most prolific murderer and unlocked 93 confessions
events.description: Retired Texas Ranger James Holland reveals how he got Samuel Little to confess to 93 murders, making him "the most prolific serial killer in U.S. history."

events.title: Utah doomsday mom arrested abroad after allegedly abducting four kids, dumping them in European orphanage
events.description: Utah mother accused of kidnapping four children and abandoning them in Croatian orphanage after allegedly believing "end times" were coming to America.

events.title: Father claims daughter accused of sex crimes with Florida middle schoolers is the 'real victim'
events.description: A Florida woman back in jail after being arrested again has faced multiple charges of sexual abuse of minors, but her father argues she is the victim.

events.title: Israel, Egypt coordinate reopening of Rafah Crossing in test before Gaza residents allowed through
events.description: Israel and Egypt reopened the Rafah Crossing between Gaza and Egypt in a limited test on Sunday as part of the ongoing 20-point peace plan.

events.title: Hundreds of political prisoners in Venezuela could be released under new amnesty bill
events.description: Venezuela's acting president announces amnesty bill that could free hundreds of political prisoners, including opposition leaders and journalists.

events.title: Israel set to reopen Gazaâ€™s Rafah border crossing with Egypt for first time since May 2024
events.description: Israel announced that the Rafah border crossing between Egypt and the Gaza Strip will reopen "for limited movement of people only" on Sunday, Feb. 1.

events.title: 80-year-old lottery winner sentenced for bankrolling $400M drug empire from cottage with son
events.description: Lottery winner John Eric Spiby, 80, was sentenced to 16 years in prison for running a $400 million counterfeit pill empire from his cottage after a 2010 windfall.
